Title: June 2011
Content: 20 *p38480a02024*     (ii) use either the half-equations in (i) or that the mole ratio of ch3ch2oh:cr2o72  is 3:2 to construct the ionic equation for the reaction between ethanol and acidified dichromate(vi) ions.  state symbols are not required. (1)    *(iii) the iodine formed in the experiment reacted completely with 34.40 cm3 of the  0.0250 mol dm 3 sodium thiosulfate solution.  use this information, the fact  that the mole ratio of ch3ch2oh:cr2o72  is 3:2 and the equations below, to  calculate the concentration of the ethanol in the 5.00 cm3 of the diluted sample  of the drink.
